plusPeriod
The function adds the specified calendar time to the specified date.
Syntax
plusPeriod
(periodId, date, count)
Setting
Purpose
periodId
Selecting the type of dynamics (time period).
The type of dynamics is determined by the "Type of dynamics" directory [SPR_DYN_TYPE]. Possible values:
second;
minute;
hour;
day;
month;
year.
date
The date to which the specified amount of calendar time must be added.
The date can be specified as an
attribute
, a
variable
or an
algorithm
.
count
The number of units of the specified dynamic type that will be added by the specified date.
Note
The function is called from
"Dates" tab
on the toolbar of the algorithm editor, which opens a modal window for selecting the dynamics type.
When calling the function, the "date" parameter is set to
"currentDate()"
, and the "count" parameter is set to 1.
Subtraction is done by passing a negative value to the "count" parameter.
Use example

function, the parking duration specified in hours is added to the start time, while the values of the "Start time" and "Parking time (hours)" attributes are obtained using the

As a result, when the parking time changes, the end time of the parking period will be recalculated and displayed.
